intro: Heptapleurum rugosum, commonly known as the roughleaf holly, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers. The plant has rough, textured leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. It thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments and is often used as an ornamental plant in gardens. Heptapleurum rugosum is also valued for its ability to tolerate various soil conditions and its slow growth rate.
